intro: Justicia eberhardtii, commonly known as the red-veined justicia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers with contrasting green veins. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adapted to well-drained soils.
